alert.note: Alert for Chester (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 27 at 11:06PM EST until December 28 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... East Branch Brandywine Creek Below Downingtown affecting Chester County. For the Brandywine Creek...including Downingtown...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...East Branch Brandywine Creek below Downingtown. * WHEN...From this evening to early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, Open adjacent land next to the creek floods. At 8.0 feet, Dowlin Forge Road begins to flood. At 9.0 feet, High water on the Brandywine sends backwater up Beaver Creek. Beaver Creek floods inundating parks and the Downingtown Little League fields. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 5.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 8.9 feet late tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.0 feet on 04/03/2005. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (11 pm) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Stg Time Date East Branch Bran Downingtown 7.0 5.9 Wed 10 p 3.7 MSG 8.9 4am 12/28 &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued Thursday afternoon at 100 PM EST.
